review_blob: Bottle. Pours a very dark red / brown, with only a slight head. The aroma is honey, caramel, maybe molasses. Tastes filling, rich and meaty. Quite fizzy at first, tasted better after being left to settle for a while. Honey aftertaste. I brought a bootle of this back from Belgium but it didnt seem to taste as good as it did there (on draught)

Cask at Derby Winter ales festival. A very light gold colour. Aroma of rising dough, and tasted like it too! Mouth filling. Smooth but bland. Sweetish. I drank this as my boyfriend (a mild drinker) hated it, and I quite enjoyed it although I dont usually like mild.

Cask at Derby Winter ales festival. Light golden colour. Aroma: gingernut biscuits and almonds. Tasted more like a white wime than a beer in some ways. Light palate, sweetish, light fruits, possibly lemongrass? The aftertaste was  more warming and traditionally beery. I loved this although I can see that hardcore beer fans might not.
Gold colour, sharp aroma. Initially sharp / citrussy taste, but a smoother / spicy aftertaste. Quite warming. Light on the palate.

Smells like onions in gravy! Colour is darkish, nothing special. Very mouth filling and rich taste which lingers in the mouth. Very sweet compared to most beers, but not cloying at least to my taste, although the aftertaste is a little bitterer. Strong biscuity taste, seems like it would be great in pies.
Bottle from Somerfield.
Deep red and slightly cloudy appearance, only slight cherry aroma. Very acidic to start, but long finish with cherries coming through. Intense.  Needs to be drunk slowly.
